department.dept_long_name: Department of the History of Art and Architecture

course.title: Rome: Eternal City
course.description: An architectural history of Rome from the empire through the early Christian and medieval city, the Renaissance revival of antiquity, Baroque planning, and early archeology to Fascism and modernism, including the imperial fora, aqueducts, fountains, medieval basilicas, the piazza, villas, gardens, St. Peter's and the Vatican complex.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Aesthetic and Interpretive Understanding. This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
